title: Episode 146 - Microservices
description: In this episode we talking about Microservices with Christian Horsdal WIN A COPY OF MICROSERVICES IN .NET 2nd EDITION To win a copy enter the draw here: https://cynical.dev/microservices2ndedition   Contacting Christian Horsdal Website: https://www.horsdal-consult.dk/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/chr_horsdal LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/christianhorsdal Book: https://www.manning.com/books/microservices-in-net-core-second-edition   Episode Editing by - RJJ Software Ltd (https://rjj-software.co.uk/ )

text: Episode 146 Guest: Christian Horsdal 03 Aug 2020 | In this episode we talking about Microservices with Christian Horsdal Comments Please leave a comment, positive, negative or just something weird. Christian Horsdal Christian is an independent consultant and contractor, working with clients to improve their ability to deliver software supported solutions to business problems. This is done typically by helping them to improve their software architecture, their ability to deliver continuously and their code quality. Over the last 7 years Christian has focused on microservices, but has also worked on a wide variety of software throughout his 20+ years as a software developer. He is currently writing the 2nd edition of his book; Microservices in .NET, which is already out in early access. Guest Episodes: Episode 146 - Microservices
html:
Episode 146 Guest: Christian Horsdal

03 Aug 2020 |

In this episode we talking about Microservices with Christian Horsdal

Comments

Please leave a comment, positive, negative or just something weird.

Christian Horsdal

Christian is an independent consultant and contractor, working with clients to improve their ability to deliver software supported solutions to business problems.
This is done typically by helping them to improve their software architecture, their ability to deliver continuously and their code quality.

Over the last 7 years Christian has focused on microservices, but has also worked on a wide variety of software throughout his 20+ years as a software developer.
He is currently writing the 2nd edition of his book; Microservices in .NET, which is already out in early access.

Guest Episodes:

  • Episode 146 - Microservices
